content.question: A sample of size <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> will be selected from a population with population proportion <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following must be true for the sampling distribution of the sample proportion to be approximately normal?

choices.label: Both <math alttext="n p " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="n times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are at least 10.
The mean is equal to <math alttext="n p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The variance is equal to <math alttext="n p times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Both <math alttext="n p " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="n times, open parenthesis, 1 minus p, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>p</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> are at least 10.
